website_summaries.verdict: It is a simple, effective tool for practicing both offense and defense, in spite of potentially suspect construction.
pros: Good tool for teaching offense and defense
cons: Plastic construction is not strong, and durability is an issue

customer_reviews.title: This was great fun for about 1 hour for the kids
customer_reviews.text: This was great fun for about 1 hour for the kids. The catapult disintegrated. one would think for the price the launcher would have been made of something other than brittle plastic. This had the potential of being a source of grate entertainment for the kids. I am quite capable of preparing the machine but I need A replacement Catapult. I was feeling great about this product but now the kids are upset with me and I feel like a chump.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick T. Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Tennis balls worked the best.
customer_reviews.text: This will not really toss the ball to you as described. You literally have to stand right next to it and the machine will pop one up to you about 3 feet in the air. Tried to put it on the setting to help with catching, it launched it about 2 feet in front of the machine, very lightly. We tried waffle balls, practice balls, tennis balls and real balls. Tennis balls worked the best.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: Hidden Practice Gem
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as a machine to help me do some stress relief in the backyard. It turned in to me and my son hitting balls for hours on end. This machine works great and he only reason I gave it 4 stars out of 5 is the screw on balance legs came apart after a short while but it’s nothing some gorilla glue can’t remedy. Sometimes the balls don’t pop right but it adds to the batters skills to take one inside or reach over the plate. I haven’t played baseball in forever and hitting again rejuvenated my love of the game.
customer_reviews.author: Chir DeMointer

customer_reviews.title: JUNK "Do Not Disappoint Your Child By Buying This !!!"
customer_reviews.text: Would have to give this NO stars. Absolute JUNK..Purchased and the motor only lasted a month if that. Now it takes almost 3 min to cock back and throw. Do not buy this product, they wouldn't even stand behind it when I contacted them.....
customer_reviews.author: Ed Sears

customer_reviews.title: Great for training or just fun!
customer_reviews.text: Great buy! Great for working on timing and just proper mechanics its a soft toss machine it is what it is. Also if they want to work out they don't need a partner the machine can toss it to him/her and they can throw it into a net great. It's one of the least expensive machines on the market right now provides exactly what they do for a fraction of the cost.
customer_reviews.author: 1111scale1111

customer_reviews.title: Upset that I had to even give this item a ...
customer_reviews.text: Upset that I had to even give this item a star. The first one was sent with a broken trajectory lever knob. The balls never could get over the lever that placed them in the ejector. I played around with the ball funnel location but that did not work. We I received the replacement machine the spring was off the bolt. Tried for an hour to reattach the but before I realized that I should not have to fix a new out of the box item. Stay away, the videos for the item don't tell the real story.
customer_reviews.author: Christine Hogan

customer_reviews.title: Good so far
customer_reviews.text: We have only had this a couple days, but it seems to work great. Sometimes the ball doesn't drop down, but we are still happy with it. My 7 year old can easily start and stop it. He also experimented with tennis balls, they go a little bit higher and farther than the baseballs. Overall, we are happy.
customer_reviews.author: RPG

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy!
customer_reviews.text: BAll does not launch. If u get one to launch next 2 come out at same time about 3 inches above machine. Could never use for fly balls not high enough for a 6 years old to hit. However can use tennis balls to try and hit. Don’t buy!!!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Arthrell

customer_reviews.title: Love it for solo workouts!
customer_reviews.text: works great so far. Seems like the ball holder and launcher is not extremely robust, but is working fine after 1 month. I cannot see this holding up for multiple people, but for the price it has done its job perfectly for my 12year old to hit soft toss balls into a Bownet when no one is around to throw to him or he wants to hit some balls in the garage when it is raining.
customer_reviews.author: CA Dad

customer_reviews.title: Nice product if no one else around to do soft toss
customer_reviews.text: If you are going to be doing soft toss with wiffle balls use batteries If you are going to do soft toss with hard balls use the 120v ac adapter Works good and is very repeatable once you get it dialed in
customer_reviews.author: hulla007

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the money
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my son so he could take some soft toss with it on some real baseballs... it doesn't have enough power to get them in the strike zone on a 9/10 year old average height kid. Spend the extra money on something else besides this product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Lee

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t sit level or maintain tension on the adjustment knob
customer_reviews.text: This machine is a piece of crap. It doesn’t do anything like they claim. It’s a total waste of money. Update*** 5/21/18*** I threw this machine away over the weekend. It’s a piece of crap.
customer_reviews.author: Weekendrockstars

customer_reviews.title: Scrap
customer_reviews.text: Poorly made could not get the battery lid off so left it on when I returned every time the ball would get pitched machine sounded like it was breaking never an accurate throw tried real baseball barely left machine more like rolled off the machine don’t recommend this product
customer_reviews.author: LDU

customer_reviews.title: Hours of fun
customer_reviews.text: With an active son and a little baby at the house this allowed for son to get hours of entertainment in the yard while mom stays with baby. Has increased his ability to get ground balls and fly balls.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Santiago

customer_reviews.title: Amazing product for youth to use to learn on
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product for youth to use to learn on... very quick setup... could use more spiral ball feeders so you can hold more than 8 balls but it works you can also order more feeders through Skillz themselves so makes it easy just have to wait for shipping. Got 3 boys who all use the same one and the all love it
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for extra swings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this trainer for my 13 and 10 year old boys for some extra batting practice when I am not around and it does the job. We use whiffle balls which work good, but there are times when the loading mechanism allows for two balls to come out at one time. Also, the ball holder is flimsy and doesn't stay connected to the unit all the time. Overall, it works good but I would have preferred that the price was around $30 to $40 dollars to get maximum value from it.
customer_reviews.author: Joe

customer_reviews.title: great little compact pitching machine
customer_reviews.text: i got all my grandkids together that are playing baseball this year and let them go at it. nice and compact for teaching hand/eye. only drawback is that you have to have electricity outlet close by. Also it only holds a few baseballs and would be nicer if it held a ton but thats not a big deal. the batter only gets a couple trays and then has to trade off.
customer_reviews.author: Shoutz

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for soft toss
customer_reviews.text: Awesome for soft toss. Use in conjunction with the SKLZ pop up net and is great for warm ups and working on the swing Kids absolutely love it and use it a few times a week. Can be plugged in or battery operated
customer_reviews.author: guido13

customer_reviews.title: Decent Machine, Fair Price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine for beginners, but don't expect a sturdy metal pitching machine. It's serving us well and getting my son really comfortable hitting the ball. One drawback, and this may be user error, is the machine double feeds the plastic practice balls that I wanted him to use for simple catching drill, so we are sticking to hitting. Other than that it's easy to move around and adjust and we have fun.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Zarski

customer_reviews.title: great soft toss machine
customer_reviews.text: My boys love this. It is great as a started machine, especially for the price. We use it a lot for pop flies. My 6 year old just started coach pitch, so this is perfect for him.
customer_reviews.author: tomi garza

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Used it for granddaughters to practice hitting softballs & they loved it
customer_reviews.author: Allen Frazier

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: My grandson loves this tossing machine. It really works well. The balls are indestructable.
customer_reviews.author: Stormin

customer_reviews.title: Great product My 6 year old I using it to ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product My 6 year old I using it to get him ready for coach pitch
customer_reviews.author: acabello

customer_reviews.title: Nice concept
customer_reviews.text: The ball compartment attaches with a small plastic clip. It keeps falling out when my son is working on hitting. Would have just purchased a more expensive one had I know ahead of time, but it had great reviews until I went to other sites and found the same problem listed.
customer_reviews.author: Shelly M

customer_reviews.title: It could be so much better, but breaks easy ☹
customer_reviews.text: The rails are plastic and break easy. The first one I purchased the rail came broken and the second one the rail broke while my 8 years old son was having his first batting practice with it; disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Edwin De la Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Needs quite a bit of adjustment but works great. Does not throw real balls very far but ...
customer_reviews.text: Needs quite a bit of adjustment but works great. Does not throw real balls very far but really is just a light toss
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Didn’t work like I thought it would. Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 12 year old grandson. The balls all fell down at the same time instead of one at a time. Balls don’t go very far when they come out. Very disappointed with this. Sending back.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Hoffman

customer_reviews.title: The reload gets stuck and the spiral ball collector does ...
customer_reviews.text: The reload gets stuck and the spiral ball collector does not stay lined up. The adjustment is not accurate either ☹️
customer_reviews.author: K Baca

customer_reviews.title: Both work great!
customer_reviews.text: The product came as advertised. I have used it several times with the power cord and with 4 D batteries. The batteries actually last a while. I have used it with real balls and with the foam balls. Both work great!
customer_reviews.author: Brian Vediz

customer_reviews.title: Garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy this. When I installed the ball feeder I realized that I didn't line it up right. When I tried to fix it it cracked into a dozen pieces. They really need to put more thought into the design of this product.
customer_reviews.author: Chris B.

customer_reviews.title: difficult to adjust
customer_reviews.text: I've tried several different ways, but it doesn't do "Soft Toss." I've tried different angles and adjustments. It does pop-ups. I might try it outside to see if it needs heavier balls.
customer_reviews.author: Shad Fanta

customer_reviews.title: It is good for a beginner to get the feel of a ...
customer_reviews.text: It will not throw a baseball but just a few feet. The batter has to be right at the machine to be able to hit a baseball. It does fair with a tennis ball or a plastic ball. It is good for a beginner to get the feel of a real bat on a real baseball. I would not recommend this to anyone who has any playing experience at all.
customer_reviews.author: David E. Price

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: Won’t even launch the ball 3 feet, waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Jessica A. Roche

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great training tool was surprised by its compact size but does the job
customer_reviews.author: robert wilkinson

customer_reviews.title: Grandson Loves it!
customer_reviews.text: easy set up, portable and excellent value for the Money.
customer_reviews.author: Doug B

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Good substitute for soft toss. Plastic, the case is already missing a chunk where a ground ball came back and broke it. But for the price, it's am fine product.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M. Suydam

customer_reviews.title: First one we received the plastic cover was broken but ...
customer_reviews.text: First one we received the plastic cover was broken but stilled tried it and worked well but wires were exposed so the second one is on its way and should be here Monday or Tuesday can't wait to let the boy start using it everyday
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... rack for the ball was flimsy with and broke easily, needs to be more sturdy
customer_reviews.text: Bought it used on the post and rack for the ball was flimsy with and broke easily, needs to be more sturdy, an attachment would be nice to hold more balls
customer_reviews.author: Wesley

customer_reviews.title: The metal pin that comes up to prevent all the balls from feeding into the throwing mechanism sometimes gets wedged into the hol
customer_reviews.text: 3 might be generous! The metal pin that comes up to prevent all the balls from feeding into the throwing mechanism sometimes gets wedged into the holes of the ball otherwise it's fun.
customer_reviews.author: md in nc

customer_reviews.title: I knew that for $70, the quality would be ...
customer_reviews.text: I knew that for $70, the quality would be questionable. This product does what it is designed to do, but seems extremely delicate.
customer_reviews.author: investor

customer_reviews.title: Believe the poor reviews!
customer_reviews.text: Never worked properly. Hardly has enough power to get the balls a foot off the ground. Pieces broke off as well.
customer_reviews.author: James Austin

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done
customer_reviews.text: It gets the job done. I bought it to launch tennis balls, don't expect hard throws but it gives you a good throw for your to use the racket by yourself and practice it launches a good 2 feet distance at a decent speed
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE IT!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so I can hit with the new power net I purchased. This is a SOFT TOSS machine, it's not a pitching machine so it won't throw lobs from the pitching mound distance. Furthest will be about 7ft. Good to have when you want soft toss alone. Using it in my side yard and works perfectly! I love it!
customer_reviews.author: Daigo Kobayashi

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended!!!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome product!!! My 6 yr old son started showing major improvements in his batting skills after only the second time. We use tennis balls to practice catching pop flies and saw a major improvement in that area as well!! I will highly recommend this product to anyone. The only bad thing is that it's plastic so balls will hit it and break the casing, I solved this issue by placing a concrete block in front of it to protect the unit. A++++++++ :)
customer_reviews.author: Rocky Whitaker

customer_reviews.title: not sure how helpful it is since soft toss is pretty easy to handle without a machine
customer_reviews.text: does what it says it does. not sure how helpful it is since soft toss is pretty easy to handle without a machine. too cold to use it much
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Douglas

customer_reviews.title: This machine is fantastic. It seems that most of the poor reviews ...
customer_reviews.text: This machine is fantastic. It seems that most of the poor reviews are due to unrealistic expectations. This is not a $200+ pitching machine that can launch real baseballs.
customer_reviews.author: GrindsNGaming

customer_reviews.title: It's supposed to let only one ball to get into ...
customer_reviews.text: It's supposed to let only one ball to get into the throwing-arm, but usually two balls fell in, so I have to put the ball into it one by one, otherwise, it will stuck. It is basically only for a very beginner because it is not powerful enough to throw the ball very far.
customer_reviews.author: WM

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Bought this machine for my 11 year old son and he's very excited to use it.
customer_reviews.author: erika clubb

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this for my grandson who is 7. He used it for two days and it broke. He hit a foul ball and it hit the machine. It cracked the plastic piece. The next day the whole thing stopped working. I wrote to customer service but didn't even get a response. I would think it should last longer than 2 days with a 7 year old using it.
customer_reviews.author: DEBBIE SKELLEY

customer_reviews.title: Broke first day.
customer_reviews.text: This item broke the first day we used it. The spiral feed cracked as the balls were being fed through. Not sure what the problem was. I returned it for refund.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Beimel

customer_reviews.title: It looked like it was going to be a great way to ...
customer_reviews.text: I had high hopes for this machine. It looked like it was going to be a great way to practice by yourself, but I was upset because of its quality. The ball is not nearly elevated high enough to square it up. The pattern of the pitches malfunctions often making it hard to get into a groove. I recommend saving your money on this one.
customer_reviews.author: Melissa  M Crowley

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but does not work.
customer_reviews.text: Broke right away. A spring came out and was had to get back. Could tell more problems to come we will be sending it back
customer_reviews.author: MA

customer_reviews.title: FUN
customer_reviews.text: I played with it for five minutes and I was having a blast.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Vanlaningham

customer_reviews.title: This is a really cool device my kids love using it in the backyard ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a really cool device my kids love using it in the backyard and down at the park.
customer_reviews.author: Buck

customer_reviews.title: Didn't throw real balls very good. I returned it
customer_reviews.text: Flimsy. Didn't throw real balls very good. I returned it.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan D Newton

customer_reviews.title: My son loves it
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as expected. Regular baseballs are shot about 3-4 feet high for batting practice and plastic wuffle balls are shot about 20 feet high for pop-fly practice.
customer_reviews.author: jp

customer_reviews.title: WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this about 2 years ago and I waited to write a review to see how it would hold up. I am 23 and play amateur baseball and use this to keep my swing up in the long off season we have in Vegas. It works great for me. You can adjust the power of the toss and the level of the machine on the ground to where you want it placed. I would highly recommend it for the youngsters all the way up to adults. Also, I have only had to change the batteries once in the past two years and it hasn't broken or lost any power at all. Excellent product!
customer_reviews.author: Nicholas Lamers

customer_reviews.title: not what I expected
customer_reviews.text: not what I expected all made of plastic and just not enough power to do what we needed
customer_reviews.author: kribbmann

customer_reviews.title: Skilz Catapult
customer_reviews.text: This so called soft toss machine is a total waste of money. It does not toss the ball high at all. I had to sit it on top of a bucket and barely got the tosses high enough to be effective. I'm extremely disappointed with this product. I had good luck with the quick pitch but, no such luck this time. Awful!
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Rage Worthy POS
customer_reviews.text: Nooooope. Please listen to all of the reviewers. Feeds 2 balls at a time and jams nearly every try. Doesn't launch high enough for my 10 year old to do soft toss. Tosses a bit wild, which can be an advantage I suppose. The ball swipes the feeder which knocks it down preventing the ball from getting height. Then I tried to feed it manually one at a time without the feeder, but just couldn't get it right. This is extremely overpriced and will cause immediate rage... be warned.
customer_reviews.author: DB BluBlock Productions

customer_reviews.title: Great for tennis balls but struggles with baseballs.
customer_reviews.text: Works great for tennis balls but struggles to get enough power for real baseballs. Otherwise it is as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: mjdbkg

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: It broke after a couple of uses sent it back!
customer_reviews.author: Mae Locantore

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: this is a good little machine for the money my 8 year old son enjoys working out with it
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: I wasn't satisfied.
customer_reviews.text: After a few dozen uses, the mechanism did not always toss the ball in the same spot. After tinkering and adjusting, I ordered a replacement. I wasn't satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick B.

customer_reviews.title: Decent machine for the price
customer_reviews.text: This soft-toss machine is decent for the price. I wonder how long it will last. It falls apart easily and takes adjustment, but is fine for what it is intended to do.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Schreyer

customer_reviews.title: simple soft  toss machine
customer_reviews.text: i really like this machine. i wish these were avail when i was young.....now i must get this for my son. this is why you always hope for a baby boy ! ...actually would nt surprise me to see gals using this too. for those of you that think everything sucks......any other soft toss machine similar to this .....is hundreds of dollars. lets help a good company and help em sell plenty of these ! HIGHEST SATISFACTION RATING.
customer_reviews.author: paulpanchula

customer_reviews.title: Consider another option
customer_reviews.text: Tossing mechanism jams, does not execute on a consistent basis -- sorry I made this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amy M. Akers

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great machine when it works, but quite flimsy and breaks easily.
customer_reviews.author: SARAH J.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a Small Batting Cage
customer_reviews.text: This is a great machine. The battery lasts surprisingly long. We have never had to plug it in. It works well in our garage batting cage since we don't have enough room for a regular pitching machine. Here it is in action: [...]
customer_reviews.author: Judith Smith

customer_reviews.title: doesn't toss the ball but about 3 ft at the ...
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't toss the ball but about 3 ft at the most, even with adjustment. I know it is a soft toss but it has to be put on top of something so it will pitch high enough.
customer_reviews.author: Dawn Brook

customer_reviews.title: I tried a real baseball, but the arm/spring didn't ...
customer_reviews.text: I tried a real baseball, but the arm/spring didn't have the power to launch. I used the Skilz version of the whiffle ball, but the position of the toss was massively erratic--just couldn't get a ball consistently over the plate.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce Wilson

customer_reviews.title: ... but the housing that hold the balls cracked not good..
customer_reviews.text: It ok but the housing that hold the balls cracked not good..
customer_reviews.author: Raul Medina

customer_reviews.title: Great for self-Soft toss
customer_reviews.text: Bought this so my son could hit balls every day. It was very easy to setup and configure. The unit throws soft-toss perfectly and he can get hitting reps. in everyday by himself.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Lattro

customer_reviews.title: Should have listened to the reviews...
customer_reviews.text: I read a bunch of bad things about it's performance and I chose to buy it anyway... This machine can't toss a baseball more than 18 inches on the air... Then I loaded the wiffle balls and it was launching them in all different directions... What a disappointment..
customer_reviews.author: Brian Kelly

customer_reviews.title: Not very sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This item is discribed as duarble and easy to use. After you put together all the plastic parts, I realized its not worth the money for the item. Hard for the catapult to position in front of screens. The plastic gears ar a use away from breaking. Hopefully you don't hit it with a stray ball beacause it will probably explode. I guess I got what I paid for, a cheap knock-off for a pitching machine.
customer_reviews.author: jduser

customer_reviews.title: Okay machine
customer_reviews.text: Product is good for a t-ball player learning to catch. Not very good for anything else.do not waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: upset

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it
customer_reviews.text: It was horrible. Broke the first time we used it. Ended up just trashing on our way home from our baseball practice
customer_reviews.author: Jenni Stemkowski

customer_reviews.title: Should say whiffle ball machine!!
customer_reviews.text: Let's be totally honest here.......the picture on advertising is misleading at best....... The first one I get comes with leg hole blocked.....they did immediately replace it though so kudos for that. However....let's not kid ourselves here, this is a plastic ball throwing machine....NOT A BASEBALL MACHINE. It will toss baseballs about 5 feet on a windy day. Works very nice with plastic whiffle balls so for ages 5/6 and under it is great. And yes........the spring arm is at full strength and I have went through several sets of batteries as well as AC Adapter.....
customer_reviews.author: roy green

customer_reviews.title: Good for backyard training
customer_reviews.text: This is a good training machine for backyard practice. Some times balls get stuck but not that frequently
customer_reviews.author: Alejandro M.

customer_reviews.title: Small, minor flaws. But, well worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: I have made hundreds of purchases on Amazon, but very seldom write reviews. This product has quite a few negative reviews, so I was a little worried. My son is 11 and plays baseball year round. The soft toss machine is awesome. It does not toss to the same EXACT spot every time, but neither does live pitching. Every once in a while, when using real baseballs, a ball will get stuck and have to be pushed down the feeder. It only holds 7 real balls. Other than that, no real complaints. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Katie Marie Hedrick

customer_reviews.title: Another solid SKLZ product.
customer_reviews.text: My 6 year old loves this. Very versatile. He uses whiffle balls and this launches them as pop up practice. He uses regular balls for soft toss with his Quickster net. I love that I can focus on his mechanics and stand in the correct position to help adjust him without having to worry about placing the ball in the correct spot. Still works well after a year of use.
customer_reviews.author: K. Souligne

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Terrible, buy cheap quality the ball dont even go as far as an inch. Return it right away.
customer_reviews.author: Eneida Nunez

customer_reviews.title: works ok
customer_reviews.text: I wish it threw a little further. Max with spring cranked all the way is about 4'. Unless on a perfectly level ground, the ball feeder doesnt work correctly (wont self feed). I use this mostly because I was sick of getting hit in the face with foul balls when doing soft toss to my 6 yr. old. At least with this you can stand back 4-5' and by the time the catapult mechanism fires (every 8 seconds) it gives you time to at least step back if you want to or get your hands in a defensive position :) I guess Id buy it again in the future, just wish it was a stronger (harder) "thrower".
customer_reviews.author: Shannon Cooper

customer_reviews.title: you're hardly ever disappointed.
customer_reviews.text: Works OK with the soft T-balls. Can't see it working too well a real baseball. It rarely will reliably launch a full batch of balls. It usually ends up skipping one and doubling up on the next. It seems as flimsy as everybody says--I don't see it making it too long. I bought it for my 7 year old daughter to work on her swing. It has performed that task with the soft T-balls. This is functioning much as a I expected it. If you keep your expectations low, you're hardly ever disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AJ

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Love it for the price! Use it for baseball and pickleball.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G.

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great training tool, very user friendly and kids are enjoying it.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: It's really a piece of crap / and trying to get the company to fix there faulty product good luck they never answer the phone . Do Not Buy This I would give this a negative 5 star if I could
customer_reviews.author: gilberto  gomez

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: very good, but does not have enough power to do outfield drills. Only good for soft toss
customer_reviews.author: samalicious

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Purchase for my grandson so far it has been great
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: I was adjusting the height and the whole thing just ...
customer_reviews.text: I was adjusting the height and the whole thing just disassembled and there is almost no way to get it backtogether
customer_reviews.author: Giovanni F.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to use and convenient to toss some balls outdoor ...
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use and convenient to toss some balls outdoor with batteries, the catapult is enough small and light to enter in a small bag
customer_reviews.author: Ramazon

customer_reviews.title: I will defenetively recommend this machine
customer_reviews.text: The first machine came out defective, so they sent me second one which was also defective (it lets two ball to came out at the same time. I contact SKLZ and the tested a machine a sent me another one which works perfectly my son loves it and now he doesn't need to wait for me to practice his batting skills as well as his catcher skills.I will defenetively recommend this machine.
customer_reviews.author: tony

customer_reviews.title: Works well for beginners.
customer_reviews.text: An easy, inexpensive way to improve accuracy and form.. Sometimes, Upon initial use, It needs to be adjusted to get the ball height and trajectory just right.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A Krauss

customer_reviews.title: NOT worth more than $40
customer_reviews.text: I've had it for about a month. It's already cracked in one spot, been using it with tennis balls. Hit it with a tennis ball and the slide where the balls fit in broke in about 3 pieces. It will not launch regular baseballs correctly. The maximum height baseballs will get is about 1.5 ft. Where as tennis balls will reach about 4.5 feet. I think the reason baseballs won't work is because when it launches it hits a plastic part.
customer_reviews.author: Jackson

customer_reviews.title: very nice
customer_reviews.text: this machine real good for any age group young and old. works get on the basic baseball skill levels. Needs to hold more balls
customer_reviews.author: Russell Sims

customer_reviews.title: Its okay
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly but does not throw the ball very far and does not fit a softball. Using it for baseball soft toss it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Stanford

customer_reviews.title: Good unit
customer_reviews.text: It's a good unit for the price. It does what it says. It just can't seem to pitch wiffle balls correctly. Would recommend.....
customer_reviews.author: Juan Carlos Duenas

customer_reviews.title: Catapult Soft Toss Machine
customer_reviews.text: My five year old grandson loved it! Great way for him to practice on his own. First present he played with all day Christmas!
customer_reviews.author: Barbara

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: Item can't pitch a real baseball and the spiral track allows more than one practice ball into the catapult...Very disappointing for a SKLZ product...Design is very poor. Unfortunately, I bought this for an even more disappointed nephew for Christmas!! From hero to zero in about a 1/2 hour.
customer_reviews.author: Bob Dobolina

customer_reviews.title: DONT WASTE YOUR TIME AND MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: I am also writing a review directly on the Sklz page since this is FALSE ADVERTISEMENT! this product is a TOY and should not be listed anywhere in sports or as a training aid.... unless you are ok using only wiffle balls... and still they wouldn't go higher than 12 ft... soft toss w regulation balls... this is a joke! in the highest setting with the hardest resistant on the spring that activates the catapult will not toss the ball higher than 2 feet!! maybe it could be a training aid for a kid going from T-Ball to Coach's pitch.. but that's it... now regarding price-value, this item should cost no more than $25...
customer_reviews.author: Wander

product_meta.title: SKLZ Catapult Soft Toss Baseball Batting and Fielding Trainer
product_meta.description:
Works on both the offensive and defensive aspects of your game with the Catapult. Use regulation baseballs for soft toss or to practice footwork and glove-hand ball transfer. Or use 9" plastic balls for pop fly practice. The unit adjusts for height and distance and serves balls every 8 seconds.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
 



SKLZ CATAPULT SOFT TOSS PITCH MACHINE AND FIELDING TRAINER
Use the Catapult Soft Toss Pitching Machine to 2ork on both the offensive and defensive aspects of your game. Use regulation baseballs for soft toss or to practice footwork and glove-hand ball transfer. Or use 9" plastic balls for pop fly practice. The unit adjusts for height and distance and serves balls every 8 seconds.

FEATURES
 * Spiral ball funnel holds up to 8 regulation size baseballs
 * Automatically tosses balls every 8 seconds
 * Adjustable height and distance
 * Use with AC Adaptor or 4 D Batteries (not included)

CATAPULT USAGE

1) Add baseballs to machine 
Prior to starting the machine add up to 8 balls to the Spiral Ball Funnel.


2) Adjust ball flight angle
Before adjusting the ball flight angle turn the Catapult off. Loosen the trajectory lever knob at the frontof the machine. Adjust leg up or down to adjust the ball flight angle. Tighten trajectory lever knob. Stabilize Catapult by adjusting the rear
stability bar. Unscrew knobs on both sides of the bar and adjust height so that the bar rests on the ground. Secure into place by tightening each knob.


3) Adjust ball throwing distance
Using the adjustable distance knob, tighten to increase ball throwing distance, loosen slowly to decrease ball throwing distance.


4) Power up machine
The Catapult runs on 4 D Batteries (not included) or with the provided AC Adapter. If using the AC Adapter, connect to the side of Catapult Base below the power switch. If using batteries flip the Catapult over. Press down on the black tab and slide the
battery cover off. Install batteries as shown. Turn product ON to power up and OFF to power down. Ensure all persons and pets are clear of the Catapult and the path of the ball before powering on.







ABOUT SKLZ
SKLZ is committed to elevating the athlete in each of us by guiding and serving athletes on their journeys to be their personal best. As the flagship brand of Pro Performance Sports, based in San Diego California, SKLZ develops innovative athletic performance and skill development training products, technology and knowledge for serious athletes of all ages, skill levels and sports including baseball, football, soccer, golf, softball and basketball. SKLZ is known around the world for delivering durable, high-performance training products used by professional and amateur athletes as well as their coaches and trainers seeking to improve on a sport-specific skill or a performance-focused goal such as speed, agility, balance or core strength.
feature_bullets: Works on both the offensive and defensive aspects of the game
Builds visual acuity and hitting accuracy
Automatically tosses regulation baseballs and practice balls every 8 seconds
Adjustable height and distance.Material: Polypropylene, ABS (acrylonitrile butadiene styrene), Steel
Powered by AC adapter or batteries (batteries not included)
